snippet: The Roswell, N.M., site had been the home of an Atlas-F missile, 100 times more powerful than the atomic bomb dropped on Nagasaki. The silo is a fixer-upper, to put it mildly.
abstract: Area around Roswell, NM, is home to dozen abandoned underground nuclear missile sites, which are desirable to small subset of real estate buyers who hope to remodel them into apocalypse-proof homes; sites have drawn interest from marijuana growers, hydroponic gardeners and a document storage company.
lead_paragraph: The Roswell, N.M., site had been the home of an Atlas-F missile, 100 times more powerful than the atomic bomb dropped on Nagasaki. The silo is a fixer-upper, to put it mildly.

headline.main: Parcel for Sale: Plenty of Space. Very Quiet. Light? Well ...
headline.print_headline: Parcel for Sale: Plenty of Space. Very Quiet. Light? Well ...
